flow.informationArchitecture: Three-part structure: textual instructions + visual phone mockups + step-based TOC. Follows instructional design pattern: introduce feature, break into numbered steps, show UI for each step, link to video reinforcement
frictionPoints: Users may need to reference mockups while reading steps; alignment could be tighter
Dropdown menus for 'Convert from/to' currencies shown in mockup but interaction not explained in detail
Exchange provider selection shown but how/why to choose ChangeNOW vs SideShift not clearly explained
progressIndicators: Step numbers (Step 1, Step 2, Step 3) in main content
Visual sequence in phone mockups showing progression
Table of contents showing multiple steps

copy.headline: Cake Wallet swaps

ctas.text: You can watch our YouTube tutorials here:

microcopy.text: If you would like to swap cryptocurrencies, then you can use Cake Wallet's built-in swap. We show examples below converting Bitcoin (BTC) and Monero (XMR), but it works for many other assets as well swap services are provided third parties.
microcopy.purpose: Set expectations and explain scope of feature

microcopy.text: Go to the balance screen and tap on the 'Swap' button. Choose your desired currencies under 'Convert from' and 'Convert to', by tapping on the abbreviation with a dropdown arrow to the right.

microcopy.purpose: Explain optional setting for swap pricing

microcopy.context: Modal title in third screen mockup
microcopy.purpose: Explain how to select between ChangeNOW and SideShift

trustSignals: Third-party swap services mentioned (transparency about providers)
Multiple exchange provider options (ChangeNOW, SideShift) shown
